main event: On the night of 19 August 1949, Sgt. Donald R. Berger observed an unidentified airborne object while operating an Army General Electric antiaircraft searchlight in Cincinnati, Ohio.
interesting points: The object appeared to change color in the light beam, from a phosphorescent appearance to a bluish color, and remained visible even after the light beam was removed.
It was observed to be at an altitude of 3 to 5 miles and at about the same range, appearing to remain approximately stationary for the entire three and a half hour observation period.
The phenomenon was witnessed by several hundred people in the city and was mentioned in at least one daily newspaper.
The sighting lacked conclusive identification and was reported to military personnel at the Langley Air Force Base.
The UFO observation was made during a period when the searchlight was being operated for publicity purposes by a local group.
witnesses: Sgt. Donald R. Berger and several hundred other people
